alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 10:01PM CDT until May 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Harlan. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that thunderstorms earlier Sunday evening dropped heavy rain of generally 1 to 3 inches in a short time across much of the Advisory area. Minor flooding is likely ongoing, especially on small creeks and streams and within low-lying areas. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Methodist Creek, Cook Creek, Walnut Creek, Eureka Creek, Turkey Creek, Rope Creek, Sappa Creek, Milrose Creek, Prairie Dog Creek, Bone Creek, Dry Creek, Flag Creek, Crow Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Alma, Orleans, Republican City, Huntley and Harlan County Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
